definitions.definition: Relating to or having a theme ( “ subject ” ) or a topic .
examples: He had a thematic collection of postage stamps with flags on them (where ( UK ) thematic collection is equivalent to ( US ) topical collection)
(where ( UK ) thematic collection is equivalent to ( US ) topical collection)

definitions.definition: Of a word stem , ending in a vowel that appears in or otherwise influences the noun or verb's inflection .
Of or relating to a theme ( “ subdivision of the Byzantine empire ” ) .

main_definition: Relating to or having a theme ( “ subject ” ) or a topic .
secondary_definitions: ( music ) Relating to a melodic subject .
( grammar , Indo-European studies ) Of a word stem , ending in a vowel that appears in or otherwise influences the noun or verb's inflection .
( history ) Of or relating to a theme ( “ subdivision of the Byzantine empire ” ) .
